attributes.comment:
To Whom It May Concern: I am writing in regard to the proposed fee increase for
the I-600/I-171H for adoption abroad. My husband and I are among those many
prospective parents experiencing the long wait to adopt a girl from the P.R
China. We already have our paperwork submitted (since last May) and are
approaching the expiration of our fingerprints and I-171. Unless Congress
changes the expiration of I-171 from 18 month to 24 months, we will be re-
applying for these documents again, and incurring considerable expense to do so
to update all the forms needed to submit the I-600. I urge you to not add to our
expense of re-application of the I-600 form by increasing the fees charged for
such. Of course if the fee is increased we will pay it as we are committed to
adopt a child from China, but it would ease our financial outlay if the fees were
not increase from their current level.
Thank you.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Melene A. Rose
